snippet: The price of $3.65 billion for the almost 41.5 percent of Chrysler looks to be a fair one, writes Antony Currie of Reuters Breakingviews. And the deal with the union trust fund ends a dispute that had been festering almost 18 months.
abstract: The price of $3.65 billion for the almost 41.5 percent of Chrysler looks to be a fair one, writes Antony Currie of Reuters Breakingviews. And the deal with the union trust fund ends a dispute that had been festering almost 18 months.

headline.main: Chrysler Deal Puts Fiat Chief in the Fast Lane
